labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to provide real-time and historical cryptocurrency market data specifically from the OKX exchange. Its core functionality revolves around fetching price data and candlestick information, which are essential for traders and analysts to evaluate market trends, develop trading strategies, and make informed decisions. The available tools, get_price and get_candlesticks, facilitate quick access to this financial data without the need for complex API integrations.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" is chosen because the server's main focus is on delivering real-time and historical cryptocurrency market data from an exchange, which is fundamental to trading and financial analysis in the crypto space. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is relevant because the server provides structured data (candlesticks) that can be used for analytical purposes like trend identification or strategy backtesting. The predefined labels accurately cover the main functionalities without the need for custom labels.

tools.name: get_price
tools.description: Get latest price for an OKX instrument

tools.name: get_candlesticks
tools.description: Get candlestick data for an OKX instrument

server_info_crawled.name: OKX Server
server_info_crawled.author: @esshka/okx-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch real-time cryptocurrency price data and historical candlestick information from the OKX exchange. Access market insights effortlessly through a simple tool interface, ensuring you stay updated with the latest trends. Enhance your trading strategies with reliable and timely data at your fingertips.

tools.name: get_price
tools.description: Get latest price for an OKX instrument

tools.name: get_candlesticks
tools.description: Get candlestick data for an OKX instrument

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@esshka/okx-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
